strats.name: Leave With Platform Below - Crocomire Alive
G-mode Morph Ceiling Bomb Jump
strats.note: Touch the item while remaining in artificial morph. Ceiling bomb jump back to the left, then use x-ray to cancel g-mode and obtain the item.
strats.devNote: This strat alone would only require canBePatient, but it is only possible after Ceiling Bomb Jumping there, so it would be a combined 4 minutes.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged with Walljump
strats.note: Get a normal height jump by not pressing run while SpeedBooster is equipped, as the Shinespark is stored.

strats.name: Speedjump Wall Jump
strats.note: With a precise enough jump, it's possible to avoid acid damage without a shinespark.

strats.name: Insane Speedy Airball
strats.note: With a precise enough jump and a quick airball, it's possible to avoid acid damage without a shinespark or wall jump.

nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Junction (Bottom)
nodes.note: Represents being at the bottom of the room with G-Mode Morph (artificial morph)

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Gamet
note: Lure the Gamets up; it may be helpful to freeze them on the ascent to prevent them from separating and moving horizontally.
Freeze a Gamet at the correct height, and then use it as a platform to reach the door.
Positioning is much easier with Morph; simply morph on any of the stairs before they start separating.
Finally, freeze a Gamet while there is a half-tile gap between it and the runway in order to extend it as much as possible.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Gamet
note: Lure the Gamets to the top left door with Ice and Space Jump, Grapple, or HiJump.
First lure the Gamets vertically using the Kamer platform and Ice, which is much easier with HiJump disabled.
Then freeze them again after they separate and are high enough to align with the door.
With HiJump and another jump assist, jump to the left of the Gamets as they thaw and refreeze them a bit more to the left so that they will be on screen when Samus is on the left ledge.
It is possible with HiJump and Ice alone, but much trickier. Use the Gamets as a platform or perform a running jump from the Kamer platform to get up to the left door.

strats.name: SpaceJump across and Leave with Spark
Shinespark
strats.note: Enter on the far right side of the doorway to reach the ledge above.

strats.name: Gamet Ice Moonfall Door Lock Skip
note: Stand next to the Gamet farm on the left side.
Freeze the Gamets and destroy the second and third Gamet from the top.
Allow the first and fourth Gamets from the top to move left, and refreeze them above the door.
Perform a moonfall between them and aim down.
After gaining enough speed, move forward to fall down and clip past the door shell below.
Falling with too much speed can cause Samus to go out of bounds.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Enter on the left side of the doorway to reduce the amount of energy used.
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: Shinespark with Wave
strats.note: Kill the Gamets with Wave Beam when entering the room.

strats.name: SpaceJump up and Leave with Spark
Speedy Jump up with HiJump and Leave while Shinecharged
strats.note: Kill the Gamets with SpeedBooster and then jump directly up to the top left door.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging to Leave while Shinecharged
strats.devNote: The Gamets are killed with SpeedBooster

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging with Wave to Leave while Shinecharged
strats.devNote: The Gamets are killed with SpeedBooster

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Gamet
Shinespark with Wave
strats.note: Kill the Gamets with Wave Beam when entering the room.

strats.name: SpaceJump up and Leave with Spark
Jump up with HiJump and Leave while Shinecharged
Use HiJump and Wave to Leave while Shinecharged
strats.note: Shoot the Gamets while entering the room for more runway.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: SpaceJump across and Leave with Spark
Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.
Samus will not be visible during the climb.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Gamet
note: Lure the Gamets up; it may be helpful to freeze them on the ascent to prevent them from separating and moving horizontally.
At the top, freeze a Gamet while there is a half-tile gap between it and the runway in order to extend it as much as possible.
Positioning is much easier with Morph; simply morph on any of the stairs before they start separating.
Freezing one or two Gamets after they separate but before they start moving can help with dodging and avoiding damage.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Gamet
strats.note: Lure the Gamets while using the Kamer, then get up to the doorway with a quick crouch jump + down grab or by other means.
devNote: A crouch jump + down grab should always be usable except when preserving a blue suit.
A flash suit is lost when using X-Ray, so it can not be kept through a G-Mode setup.

strats.name: Ripper Grapple
strats.note: Involves grappling off a Ripper 2.

strats.name: Use Frozen Enemies
strats.note: Use the moving platform (Kamer) to elevate the Gamets and then freeze them.

strats.name: Hi Jump from Moving Platform
strats.note: Run on the moving platform (Kamer).

strats.name: Post Crocomire Farming Room Speed Jump
note: Doesn't require opening the bottom right door. Just using the available space and jumping late enough.
It does require killing the Gamets and leaving the drops there so they don't kill your momentum.

strats.name: Tricky Spring Ball Jump from the Platform
note: Run on the the moving platform into a midair spring ball jump as far horizontal as possible.
Unmorph or spring fling to reset fall speed can help.

strats.name: Post Crocomire Farming Room Damage Boost
strats.note: Use the moving platform (Kamer) to elevate the Gamets.

strats.name: In-room Speedy Jump up with HiJump and Leave while Shinecharged
strats.note: Shortcharge to the right and then jump from below the floating platform to reach the top left door.

strats.name: Leave with Runway
strats.note: Leave some drops after killing the Gamets so they don't respawn.

strats.name: Ripper Grapple
strats.note: Involves grappling off a Ripper 2.

strats.name: Frozen Gamet Platform
strats.note: Use the moving platform (Kamer) to elevate the Gamets and then freeze them.

strats.name: Jump Into IBJ
note: Jump into an IBJ from the moving platform (Kamer).
Although it is possible to do it without jumping, by starting next to the Gamet farm, it is harder and more obscure.

strats.name: Crouch Jump Down Grab
note: Crouch jump then down grab starting from the moving platform. A very fast crouch jump is necessary in order to not have lowered the platform too low.

strats.name: Shortcharge with HiJump and Leave Shinecharged
Shortcharge with Walljump and Leave Sparking
G-Mode Morph Spring Ball Bomb Jump
strats.note: It is possible to perform a Spring Ball Bomb Jump from the Kamer, but it is rarely useful.
strats.devNote: The Spring Ball Bomb Jump is likely only useful for avoiding a crouch jump to preserve a blue suit.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Viola
strats.note: Use a Super to knock off a Viola and follow it to this door.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged
note: Get a normal height jump by releasing run with SpeedBooster and no HiJump.
Break spin to reach the transition without a wall jump.

strats.name: Viola Ice Moonfall Door Lock Skip
note: Use a Super to bring a Viola down to the floor.
Freeze it near or on the door, freeze the Viola on the floating platform above it, moonfall between them, and aim down.
After gaining enough speed, move forward to fall down and clip past the door shell below.
This one needs relatively little fall speed.
With too much speed, Samus will land on the door shell instead of passing through.
strats.devNote: It is possible to do this without a Super, using the Violas higher up, but it seems to be extremely precise.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: Use a Super to knock off the Viola to regain mobility.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Viola
note: Use a Super to knock off a nearby Viola, then lure it to the top.
To avoid a wall jump, it is possible to use the Viola as a frozen platform.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged
note: Align with the runway while falling to avoid all of the platforms.
The door can also be opened while falling to save some time.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Viola
strats.note: Use a Super to knock off a Viola and follow it to this door.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Viola
strats.note: Use a Super to knock off the lowest Viola.

strats.name: Viola Ice Climb
strats.note: Knock a Viola off of the middle platforms and ride it up the right wall by freezing it with Ice Beam.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb
note: Climb up 3 screens, then perform a turn-around spin jump to the left to reach the platform.

strats.name: Viola Ice Clip Door Lock Skip
note: Use a Super to knock a Viola off of the middle platforms and ride it up the right wall by freezing it with Ice Beam.
Once it reaches the top door, use another Super to knock it off again, and freeze it mid-air.
Use Morph and X-Ray to stand on top of it and clip up through the door shell above.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Frozen Viola
note: Knock a Viola off of its platform and keep it on camera as it climbs to the top of the room.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Gamet
note: Lure the Gamets while preventing them from going off camera.
Spawn them when the acid is high and rising to avoid running through it.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
strats.note: Wait for the acid to lower then quickly roll part way forward to trigger the Metarees and return. Then go again without any difficulty.
strats.devNote: This is only useful if the item is Morph.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Remote Acquire
note: Wait for the acid to lower then quickly roll part way forward to trigger the Metarees and return. Then go again without any difficulty.
Killing any of the Gamets will prevent them from respawning.
With Bombs, horizontally boost then wait for the acid and IBJ above it.
It is possible with Spring Ball alone, but it is easy to take damage; perform small jumps but hold jump before landing to prevent a small bounce in which Samus can't jump.
On the return route, jump over the Gamets to let them pass instead of racing to get them off screen.
With Power Bombs alone is particularly challenging.
Kill the Gamets then place a bomb at the edge of the runway; hit the bomb with momentum and precise timing to get a boost to skip the first and land on the next safe platform.
As quickly as possible place another and let it boost horizontally to the next platform, then another to get to the item.
devNote: The requirements here are to get the item and return, as the item cannot be used during the return.
It appears that there is virtually no risk in overloading PLMs with the Power Bomb strat - the left runway isn't close enough, and even placing two on each pillar will not overload PLMs.
FIXME: Hitting the bomb with momentum needs a tech.

nodes.name: Small Platforms Junction
nodes.note: Represents being at the small platforms above the acid.

nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Junction (At Speed Blocks)
nodes.note: Represents being at the bottom of the room with G-Mode Morph (artificial morph)

strats.name: PCJR Full Room Space Jump Through Speed Blocks
strats.note: The blocks can be broken if you can generate a blue suit using the previous room's runway, and carry it to the blocks by slowing floating down with Space Jump.

strats.name: Full Speed Jump to Missile
strats.note: Jump with enough run speed to reach the wall below the Missile Item Location.

strats.name: Left-Side Enter with Shinespark
strats.note: Takes three walljumps, and must shinespark at the apex.

strats.name: Left-Side Shinespark
strats.note: Takes three walljumps, and must shinespark at the apex.

strats.name: Left-Side Enter with Shinespark and HiJump
strats.note: Walljump or build run speed using the full runway to jump high enough for the shinespark.

strats.name: Left-Side HiJump Shinespark
strats.note: Walljump or build run speed using the full runway to jump high enough for the shinespark.

strats.name: PCJR Left Side Diagonal Shinespark
note: Store a shinespark near the Grapple Room door and use the remaining runway to jump as far as possible to the right.
Once near the acid platforms, Shinespark diagonally to reach the Missile Location.

strats.name: Indiana Jones Grapple
strats.note: Grapple off several Ripper 2.

strats.name: PCJR G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump (Indirect)
strats.note: Perform a long diagonal bomb jump from the left door to the solid platforms above the acid.

strats.name: PCJR G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump (Direct)
strats.note: Perform a long diagonal bomb jump from the left door to the solid platforms above the acid.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Acid Dive IBJ
note: Bomb boost horizontally at the top of an IBJ and land in the acid, then roll to the right and bomb out to safety.
To save some Energy, it is possible to IBJ or double IBJ out of the acid onto the first solid platform.

strats.name: PCJR Wall Jump Shinespark to Left Door
strats.note: Fire off the shinespark at the apex of two consecutive walljumps.

strats.name: PCJR Big Jump Shinespark
strats.note: Charge a spark to the right, then come back, run and jump, and do a horizontal spark at the apex.

strats.name: Break Speed Blocks, Broken Power Bomb Blocks
Break Speed Blocks, Short Charge
strats.note: Commonly known as a stutter-3, this is also doable as a 4-tap.

strats.name: Mella Ice Clip Door Lock Skip
note: Freeze a Mella at a precise distance below the door in order to crouch-jump up and clip through the door shell.
The pixel window is larger and higher with Morph and an X-Ray stand-up, in which case a standing jump is used.

strats.name: Mella Farm
strats.note: Shoot the Mellas when they first begin to come on screen, and they will not move.

strats.name: Leave with Shinecharge - Power Bomb Blocks Destroyed
note: Get a normal height jump by releasing run with SpeedBooster and no HiJump.
Break spin to reach the transition without a wall jump.

strats.name: Leave with Shinecharge - Power Bomb Blocks Intact
note: Get a normal height jump by releasing run with SpeedBooster and no HiJump.
Break spin to reach the transition without a wall jump.

strats.name: Leave With Platform Below - Basic Platform
Leave With Platform Below - Upper Left Power Bomb Block
devNote: With HiJump this can be used coming up Main Street, the bottom left of Mt. Everest, and Pseudo Plasma Spark Room.
We could add other Power Bomb block platforms too (e.g. the lower ones, and on the right side), but they don't yet appear to have any application.

strats.name: Leave With Platform Below - Power Bomb Blocks Broken
Leave With Platform Below - Speed Blocks Broken
devNote: The tile next to the Power Bomb blocks is not counted as part of the jumpway, since using it would cause Samus to bonk.
A tricky jump is required because of the difficulty of avoiding the Power Bomb blocks and still reaching the door.

strats.name: Leave With Platform Below - Power Bomb and Speed Blocks Broken
devNote: This strat is for avoiding the canTrickyJump requirement when jumping left-to-right, if the Power Bomb blocks can be destroyed.
It also makes it possible to gain more speed by running a few tiles further, which is needed for certain strats.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb the Blocks
strats.note: Place a Power Bomb then exit G-Mode to break the blocks.

strats.name: Full Shinespark
strats.note: Spark from the ground, left of the Power Bomb blocks.

strats.name: Shinespark Ends Over Acid
strats.note: Spark from the ground, left of the Power Bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: A single horizontal Power Bomb boost can get Samus on top of the blocks and kill most of the Mellas.
With Bombs, killing the Mellas can be a bit tricky; it is recommended to use one to boost and place some midair before luring a Mella to more easily kill it.

strats.name: G-Mode Direct Morph
note: A single horizontal Power Bomb boost can get Samus on top of the blocks and kill most of the Mellas.
With Bombs, killing the Mellas can be a bit tricky; it is recommended to use one to boost and place some midair before luring a Mella to more easily kill it.

strats.name: Indiana Jones Grapple in Reverse
strats.note: Involves grappling off several Ripper 2.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Remote Acquire - to Left Door (Using Previous Strat)
G-Mode Morph Remote Acquire - to Right Door
Speedjump
strats.note: Run on the moving platform (Kamer).

strats.name: PCJR Frozen Mella Door
note: Lure a Mella from the right by breaking the speed blocks or using Morph.
Then you need to manipulate it to go high enough to be used as a stepping stone once frozen.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Mella
note: Lure a Mella from the right by breaking the speed blocks or using Morph.
Then manipulate it to go high enough to be used in the left doorway.
Raise the Mella up to just below the door's ledge then climb up to the door.
Then the Mella will start moving upward, which means it comes at you partially blind.
Getting it to reach the door, and not just short of the door is the hardest part.
If it drops below the camera it will be necessary to go back down and raise it some more.

strats.name: PCJR Acid Shinespark
strats.note: Gravity makes it possible to charge a spark in the acid in order to break the speed blocks.

strats.name: PCJR Springwall
note: A particularly precise springwall.
Aim the walljump at the bottom of the second sloped wall fixture, where it looks like you cant jump off of.
Optimize pause timing, use an instant morph, and get a max height springball jump. A delayed wall jump helps.

strats.name: Indy Jones Short Mella
note: Lure a Mella from the right by breaking the speed blocks or using Morph.
Then you need to manipulate it to go high enough to be used as a stepping stone once frozen.

strats.name: Indy Jones Long Mella
note: Lure a Mella from the right by breaking the speed blocks or using Morph.
Then manipulate it to go high enough to be used as a stepping stone once frozen.
Without movement items it may be necessary to continue manipulating it from above, jumping and aiming down to freeze it.

strats.name: Indy Jones Mella Ice Clip
note: Freeze the Mella at a precise location in order to jump through the crumble block, then wall jump up the long channel and mid air morph to get out.
The Mella pixel positioning window is larger and higher with Morph and an X-Ray Stand Up.
strats.devNote: While the high pixel position looks possible, it is fairly unreasonable, as it also requires very precise horizontal positioning and the Mellas are chaotic.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph to Left Door (Using Previous Strat)
G-Mode Morph Power Bomb the Blocks
G-Mode Morph Acid Dive IBJ
note: Cross the solid platforms then horizontally boost into the acid and begin an IBJ.
With more limited Energy, it is possible to IBJ high into the room and boost horizontally to fall into the acid a bit further to the left.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharged for Item Grab and Escape
X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 2 screens.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 2 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: Get to the top of the room with Spring Ball Bomb Jumps.
To cross the room, perform a Spring Ball Bomb Jump after hitting the bomb with momentum to get a larger horizontal boost, then unmorph on the descent to reset fall speed.
devNote: The HiJump strat can only be useful if preserving a blue suit. Leniency isn't included as Samus will likely unmorph.
FIXME: Hitting the bomb with momentum should probably be a tech.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharged for Item Grab and Escape
Come In Shinecharging for Item Grab and Escape
Grapple Teleport
devNote: This gets to the top left of the room without walljump or crouch jump.
Avoiding a crouch jump could be useful for preserving a flash suit.
FIXME: When we have a way to represent grapple teleporting with a shinecharge, that can also be useful here.

strats.name: HiJump
strats.note: Run and jump from the second-highest platform on the left.

strats.name: Spring Ball Jump
note: Starting from the second-highest platform on the left, run and jump into a mid-air Spring Ball jump.
It helps but is not required to then unmorph to reset fall speed.

strats.name: Speedy Airball
note: With SpeedBooster equipped, run from the top left platform and jump into an airball to reach the top right platform.
It helps but is not required to moonwalk against the wall to maximize the available runway.

strats.name: Leave Sparking
strats.note: Build some run speed to jump to the opposite runway to open the door before Shinesparking.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Gamet
note: Lure the Gamets up out of the water. It may be helpful to freeze them on the ascent to prevent them from separating and moving horizontally.
Positioning is much easier with Morph; simply morph on the runway before they start separating.
Freeze a Gamet while there is a half-tile gap between it and the runway in order to extend it as much as possible.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Gamet
note: It is possible to lure the Gamets out of the water with nothing but ledge grabs.

strats.name: G-Mode Indirect Despawn the Gate
note: Cross the room while in indirect G-Mode and the gate will not be there.
Note that if any of the Gamets are killed, none of them will respawn, but they can still be frozen and used as a platform.
It is possible but difficult to cross either of the moats with Grapple before PLMs are overloaded, but not both of them.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Gamet
note: Lure the Geemers up out of the water. It may be helpful to freeze them on the ascent to prevent them from separating and moving horizontally.
At the top, position a Gamet flush with the central runway. Positioning is much easier with Morph; simply morph on the runway before they start separating.
Freeze the Gamet before it begins moving horizontally, and it will be able to turn to the right.
Use it as a frozen platform to cross both bodies of water.
Lure the Gamet to the right and freeze it while there is a half-tile gap between it and the runway in order to extend it as much as possible.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Gamet
note: Carefully and quickly lure the Gamets to the right door without letting them go off camera.
It may help to kill any extra Gamets once they spread apart.

strats.name: G-Mode Indirect Morph IBJ Despawn the Gate
Grapple Tutorial 3 Frozen Gamet Bridge
note: Lead a Gamet up through the water and freeze it to cross the first moat.
Freeze the Gamet before it starts moving left.
Wait for it to thaw and fly over the second moat where it can be frozen again.

strats.name: Grapple Tutorial 3 Double Gamet Boost
note: 1- Stand near the farm point, on the edge of where you make Gamets spawn.
2- Wait for the water position to be high.
3- Move to make the Gamets spawn. Moonwalk is useful here.
4- Quickly climb up to the last ledge before the door.
5- Run, jump, dboost off a Gamet.
6- Dboost a second time off the Gamet to cross the second moat.

strats.name: Lenient SpringBall Bounce
note: With at least 6 tiles of run speed, jump over the first moat and MockBall into a regular springball jump over the second moat.
Aim down before reaching the ceiling to increase the jump distance.

strats.name: Tricky SpringBall Bounce
note: With around four tiles of run speed, jump over the first moat and MockBall into a regular springball jump over the second moat.
SpeedBooster makes the jump possible with a shorter runway, but the trajectory is less predictable.

strats.name: Insane SpringBall Bounce
note: With at least two tiles of run speed, jump over the first moat by maximizing the jump distance and then MockBall into a regular springball to jump over the second moat.

strats.name: Base
devNote: It is possible to use one set of the Grapple blocks in G-Mode. Generally the second moat is harder to cross so the logic is only allowing it there.
FIXME: It may be possible to cross the whole room with Grapple in G-Mode, but it would be very hard.

strats.name: Grapple Tutorial Gamet Boost
note: 1- Stand near the farm point, on the edge of where you make Gamets spawn.
2- Wait for the water position to be high.
3- Move to make the Gamets spawn. Moonwalking while facing the stairs is useful here.
4- Quickly climb up to the last ledge before the door.
5- Run, jump, dboost off a Gamet.

strats.name: Suitless SpringBall Jump
strats.note: Wait for the water to be rising and perform a max height SpringBall Jump.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.

strats.name: Fight Puyo
strats.note: Kill either the leftmost puyo or jump into the right side of the water and fight all the puyos.

strats.name: Gravity and Ice
strats.note: Either freeze the Puyos immediately on the stairs, or at the highest part of their jump to barely jump up to the ledge with HiJump.

strats.name: Tricky Jump
note: Run and jump at the very edge of the center platform.
Wait for the water level to begin lowering to walljump on the far edge.
An airball may be a little easier.

strats.name: Suitless Double SpringBall Jump
strats.note: Jump when the water level is at its lowest.
